task.title: Creating a Table of Contents in DITA

context.p: In DITA, the order and hierarchy of a document's table of contents is based directly on the DITA map that defines the document. In many media, the creation of a table of contents based on the map is automatic. For example, you do not have to do anything special to get a table of contents in WebHelp output.

In other media, you need to tell DITA where the table of contents should occur. For example, in book you need to tell DITA where to place the table of contents in the structure of the book, and whether to generate other common content lists, such as a list of figures or a list of tables. You do this by using a bookmap to define your book, and adding the appropriate elements to the frontmatter.
To configure a table of contents and other book lists:

step.cmd: Open your bookmap in the DITA Maps Manager.
Right click on the book map icon and select Append Child Frontmatter... . The Insert Reference dialog appears.
Press Insert and Close to insert the frontmatter element.
Right click on the frontmatter element and create a booklists element using Append Child Booklists... .
Use the same steps to create a toc element and to add any additional book lists elements you want such as tablelist.
